course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Introduction to Operations Management
course.description: For non-SB&M students. This course covers basic concepts and practices in production and service operations at the strategic, tactical and operational levels. Topics include product and process design, location and layout decisions, material requirements, resource planning, scheduling, and quality control.
course.exclusions: ISOM 2700, IELM 4100

reviews.author: Fatball
reviews.comment_content:
Process analysis
Quality management
Resources management
Service management
Demand forecasting
Inventory management
Supply chain management
Revenue management
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear, teach excel for some topic
however excel is not covered in final as there was a questionnaire after mid term to adjust the content of excel as there may be a lot of people dislike the excel content from the professor
reviews.comment_grading: Not so fair as all my mt and final are above mean for around 0.5 sd and still got a B
reviews.comment_workload: Not too hard, only 6 online quiz and no more homework
